latest news.eng_title: Navigating the SEC's 8-K Reporting Mandate: Cybersecurity Challenges & Compliance Realities
latest news.summary: The SEC's cybersecurity disclosure rules have been in effect for a year, but many organizations still have questions about compliance. Bill McLaughlin, president of Thrive, a managed services provider, explores some of the lingering issues. Companies must file a form 8-K within four business days after a cybersecurity event occurs, detailing the cause, resolution, and corporate impacts. The SEC recognizes that companies may not be able to determine materiality that quickly and notes that if there's not an unreasonable delay in reporting, there may be some leeway. Materiality is defined as any event that a reasonable person would consider important when making an investment decision, including operational, reputational, legal, and customer impact. Companies must submit a 10-K report every year to the SEC, while they file an 8-K form only after an incident has occurred. Both reports should err on the side of including more detail to fulfill requirements instead of withholding information. The SEC mandates that companies report each significant breach to assist investors in identifying potential pitfalls. If an incident occurs and is unreported but is later determined to be'material,' the four-day reporting clock begins then. The initial report provides an outline of the incident, and follow-up information will be filed, including incident response, resolution, impacts, etc. Incidents are reported in EDGAR, the SEC's electronic data gathering, analysis and retrieval system, regardless of resolution progress. The initial report and all updates carry the same board certification mandates as other SEC reports, putting an onus on the board to have cybersecurity understanding or skills.
latest news.title: Navigating the SEC's 8-K Reporting Mandate: Cybersecurity Challenges & Compliance Realities

latest news.eng_title: Van ECK Associates Corp Sells 7,179 Shares of Catalent, Inc. (NYSE:CTLT)

latest news.summary: Van ECK Associates Corp decreased its holdings in Catalent, Inc. (NYSE:CTLT) by 7.8% in the second quarter, according to the company's most recent 13F filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The fund owned 84,441 shares of the company's stock after selling 7,179 shares during the period. Several other institutional investors and hedge funds also recently added to or reduced their stakes in CTLT. Dimensional Fund Advisors LP lifted its stake in shares of Catalent by 29.9% in the 4th quarter. UBS Group AG raised its holdings in Catalent by 2.6% during the 4th quarter. BNP PARIBAS ASSET MANAGEMENT Holding S.A. boosted its stake in Catalent by 2,792.9% during the first quarter. UniSuper Management Pty Ltd increased its position in Catalent by 509.4% during the first quarter. Catalent's stock performance has been mixed, with shares opening at $60.70 on Wednesday. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.37, a quick ratio of 1.77, and a current ratio of 2.51. Analysts have issued mixed ratings for the company, with one investment analyst rating the stock as a sell, six as a hold, and two as a buy. The company's CEO, Alessandro Maselli, sold 9,088 shares of Catalent stock in a transaction on Monday, July 29th. The sale was disclosed in a filing with the SEC, which is available at the SEC website. Insiders have sold a total of 13,409 shares of company stock valued at $782,923 over the last quarter. 0.31% of the stock is owned by corporate insiders.
latest news.title: Van ECK Associates Corp Sells 7,179 Shares of Catalent, Inc. (NYSE:CTLT)

latest news.eng_title: Investors in Vicor Corporation Should Contact Levi & Korsinsky Before September 23, 2024 to Discuss Your Rights
latest news.summary: Investors in Vicor Corporation who suffered losses between April 26, 2023 and February 22, 2024 may be eligible for a potential recovery under the federal securities laws. According to a class action lawsuit, Vicor's stock price fell approximately 60% after the company failed to disclose a significant deal for its H100 product, which was initially believed to be with Nvidia Corporation. The lawsuit alleges that Vicor's statements created a false impression, and the company's stock price has not recovered. If you suffered a loss in Vicor stock during this time frame, you can contact Levi & Korsinsky, a nationally-recognized securities litigation firm, to learn about your rights to seek a recovery. There is no cost or obligation to participate. 'Over the past 20 years, Levi & Korsinsky LLP has established itself as a nationally-recognized securities litigation firm that has secured hundreds of millions of dollars for aggrieved shareholders and built a track record of winning high-stakes cases,' said Ed Korsinsky, Esq. 'We have extensive expertise representing investors in complex securities litigation and a team of over 70 employees to serve our clients.'
latest news.title: Investors in Vicor Corporation Should Contact Levi & Korsinsky Before September 23, 2024 to Discuss Your Rights

latest news.eng_title: Vince Announces Reporting Date for Second Quarter 2024 Financial Results By Investing.com
latest news.summary: Vince Holding Corp. (NYSE: VNCE) announced that it will report its second quarter 2024 financial results post-market on Monday, September 16, 2024. The company will also hold a conference call at 4:30 p.m. ET to discuss its financial results. latest news.eng_title: Law Offices of Howard G. Smith Reminds Investors of Looming Deadline in the Class Action Lawsuit Against Endava, plc (DAVA)
latest news.summary: The Law Offices of Howard G. Smith reminds investors of the October 25, 2024 deadline to file a lead plaintiff motion in the class action lawsuit against Endava, plc (DAVA). The lawsuit alleges that the company made false and misleading statements about its business, operations, and prospects during the class period from May 23, 2023 to February 28, 2024. On February 29, 2024, Endava released its second quarter fiscal 2024 financial results, which fell below estimates and led to a stock price drop of $26.65, or 41.8%, to close at $37.17 per share. If you purchased or otherwise acquired Endava securities during the class period, you may move the Court to ask to be appointed as lead plaintiff by October 25, 2024. You may also retain counsel of your choice or take no action and remain an absent member of the class action.
latest news.title: Law Offices of Howard G. Smith Reminds Investors of Looming Deadline in the Class Action Lawsuit Against Endava, plc (DAVA)

latest news.eng_title: ROSEN, NATIONAL TRIAL LAWYERS, Encourages Vicor Corporation Investors to Secure Counsel Before Important Deadline in Securities Class Action
latest news.summary: Rosen Law Firm, a global investor rights law firm, reminds purchasers of Vicor Corporation common stock between April 26, 2023 and February 22, 2024, of the important September 23, 2024 lead plaintiff deadline in a securities class action lawsuit. According to the lawsuit, defendants created a false impression that Vicor had secured a significant deal for its H100 product, which proved incorrect when the Company failed to discuss the deal and later announced a sharp reversal in new contracts and sales. Investors who purchased Vicor common stock during the Class Period may be entitled to compensation without payment of any out of pocket fees or costs through a contingency fee arrangement. To join the Vicor class action, go to https://rosenlegal.com/submit-form/?case_id=27447 or call Phillip Kim, Esq. toll-free at 866-767-3653 or email [email protected] for information on the class action. Rosen Law Firm has a track record of success in leadership roles and has recovered hundreds of millions of dollars for investors.
latest news.title: ROSEN, NATIONAL TRIAL LAWYERS, Encourages Vicor Corporation Investors to Secure Counsel Before Important Deadline in Securities Class Action

latest news.eng_title: Super Micro's stock bounces as company calls short-seller report 'misleading'
latest news.summary: Super Micro Computer Inc. is trying to reassure its customers and partners after a critical report from a short seller and a delay in its 10-K filing. The company stated that it doesn't expect the delayed annual filing to contain materially different results from those already reported for the latest fiscal year. According to a filing, Super Micro expressed this to its customers, saying that the delayed filing will not have a significant impact on the results already reported. 'The company is looking to reassure its customers and partners in the wake of a critical report from a short seller and the server maker's own announcement that it plans to delay its 10-K filing,' said Super Micro. 'We want to assure our customers that the delayed filing will not have a significant impact on the results already reported,' the company added.
latest news.title: Super Micro's stock bounces as company calls short-seller report 'misleading'

latest news.eng_title: SEC Requires Registered Funds To Provide More Frequent Portfolio Transparency
latest news.summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has announced significant amendments to Form N-PORT reporting requirements for registered funds, including mutual funds and closed-end funds. The amendments will require registered funds to file their Form N-PORT on a monthly basis within 30 days of the month's end, with the reports becoming publicly available 60 days after the end of the month. This change aims to reduce the lag in reporting, providing investors with more up-to-date information about registered funds' portfolio holdings. The amendments will become effective on November 17, 2025, with smaller funds having six months to comply.
latest news.title: SEC Requires Registered Funds To Provide More Frequent Portfolio Transparency

latest news.summary: Catalent Inc. reported fiscal fourth-quarter net income of $23 million, with a profit of 13 cents per share. Adjusted earnings came to 65 cents per share, surpassing Wall Street expectations. The company's revenue of $1.3 billion also exceeded forecasts, with a year-end loss of $1.04 billion and revenue of $4.38 billion. According to Zacks Investment Research, the results topped analyst estimates, with the average expectation being 46 cents per share in earnings and $1.23 billion in revenue.
latest news.title: Catalent: Fiscal Q4 Earnings Snapshot

news knowledge.summary: Catalent announced on Friday that it would not be able to file its annual report on time, as it needs more time to complete 'certain processes'. The company, which fills and finishes medication, including Novo Nordisk's flagship drug Wegovy, was expected to file the report by August 29. Catalent is waiting for the conclusion of the $16.5 billion acquisition deal signed in February by Novo Holdings, the majority shareholder of the Danish pharmaceutical company Novo Nordisk. The company expects the deal to be completed by the end of the year. Catalent exceeded analysts' estimates for fourth-quarter revenue, thanks to its biologics segment, which develops and manufactures cell and gene therapies.
news knowledge.title: Catalent retarde le dépôt de son rapport annuel

news knowledge.summary: Catalent has delayed its 10-K filing due to the need for additional time to complete certain processes and closing procedures. The company does not expect any material changes to its financial results compared to its previous earnings release. Despite this, Catalent beat Wall Street forecasts in its Q4 FY24 financials, and reiterated its plans to close its $16.5 billion buyout transaction with Novo Holdings by the end of 2024. The stock closed marginally higher on Friday.
news knowledge.title: Catalent delays 10-K filing (NYSE:CTLT)

news knowledge.eng_title: Catalent, Inc. Reports Fourth Quarter and Fiscal 2024 Results
news knowledge.summary: Catalent, Inc. has released its fourth quarter and fiscal 2024 results. The company reported net revenue of $1.30 billion, a 23% increase from the same period last year. Adjusted EBITDA was $305 million, a 150% increase from the same period last year. The company's Biologics segment reported a 51% increase in net revenue and a 735% increase in segment EBITDA. The company's Pharma and Consumer Health segment reported a 7% increase in net revenue and a 22% increase in segment EBITDA. Catalent's President and CEO, Alessandro Maselli, said, 'I am pleased to report that Catalent ended our fiscal 2024 in a strong position, including growing non-COVID revenue by nearly 30% in the fourth quarter.' The company's pending transaction with Novo Holdings is expected to close towards the end of calendar year 2024. Catalent will not host an earnings conference call and will no longer provide forward-looking guidance due to the pending transaction.
news knowledge.title: Catalent, Inc. Reports Fourth Quarter and Fiscal 2024 Results

news knowledge.eng_title: What Late SEC Filers Need To Know In 2024
news knowledge.summary: Companies that fail to file their SEC reports on time may face severe consequences, including delisting from stock exchanges, trading halts, and potential revocation of their registration under the Exchange Act. The SEC requires companies to file annual and quarterly reports on Forms 10-K and 10-Q, respectively, within specific deadlines. If a company misses a deadline, it must file a Form 12b-25 within one business day, disclosing its inability to file the report timely and the reason for the delay. The company then has 15 calendar days to file the required report, or 30 calendar days for a Form 10-K or 20-F. Failure to file the report within the extended time period may result in delisting. Companies listed on the NYSE or NASDAQ must also issue a press release announcing the failure to file timely a periodic report with the SEC. The SEC may suspend trading in the company's securities for up to 10 trading days or institute an administrative proceeding against the late filer. Companies that have previously relied on Form S-3 or Form F-3 for shelf registrations and have become ineligible to utilize these forms due to late filings may not be able to file a new registration statement for at least 12 months from the original filing due date. The SEC provides exceptions for certain Form 8-K disclosure items, but failure to file timely under other items will result in a loss of Form S-3 eligibility.
news knowledge.title: What Late SEC Filers Need To Know In 2024

news knowledge.eng_title: Guru Fundamental Report for CTLT - Benjamin Graham
news knowledge.summary: Catalent Inc (CTLT) is a large-cap growth stock in the Biotechnology & Drugs industry. According to Validea's guru fundamental report, CTLT rates highest using the Value Investor model based on the published strategy of Benjamin Graham. The report gives CTLT a rating of 43% based on its underlying fundamentals and valuation. The strategy screens for stocks with low P/B and P/E ratios, low debt, and solid long-term earnings growth. Benjamin Graham, known as the 'Father of Value Investing', built his fortune and reputation after living through difficult times, including the Great Depression. His investment firm posted returns of about 20% per annum from 1936 to 1956, outpacing the market average of 12.2%.
news knowledge.title: Guru Fundamental Report for CTLT - Benjamin Graham

news knowledge.eng_title: Trimble to Update and Reconvene 2024 Annual Meeting
news knowledge.summary: Trimble Inc. has announced that it will update and reconvene its 2024 annual meeting due to delays in filing the revised annual report. The original report was filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on February 26, 2024. The company has undergone an in-depth review by Ernst & Young LLP (EY), which is expected to be completed within the next month. According to Trimble's management, no errors have been found that would require a re-determination of the consolidated financial statements, and EY has not withdrawn the audit report included in the original Form 10-K. Due to the imminent completion of the review procedures, Trimble intends to update its annual meeting scheduled for August 14, 2024, and reconvene it on September 30, 2024, at 10:00 AM (Mountain Time), via remote communication. The company expects to file the revised Form 10-K with the SEC by that date. Registered shareholders as of April 1, 2024, can vote at the reconvened annual meeting. Proxies already submitted will be valid for the new meeting date unless revoked. Shareholders who have voted do not need to take further action unless they wish to change their vote. Those who wish to change their vote can do so online or by phone until 11:59 PM (Eastern Time) on September 29, 2024, or virtually during the meeting.
news knowledge.title: Trimble riconvocherà l'assemblea annuale del 2024 dopo il completamento della revisione contabile Da Investing.com

The reports highlight the companies' financial performance, growth drivers, and strategic maneuvers. Power Integrations reported a robust set of financial results, while Allegro MicroSystems demonstrated revenue growth and strong market performance. Teradata reported earnings in line with expectations, and Tenable Holdings showed a robust start to the year. Catalent exhibited solid performance and reaffirmed its full-year guidance.
